Public Network

Financial Sector and
financial instruments

Apla developed a system for banks and other financial intitutions to sell financial instruments to investors

Client

Innovative fintech company

Summary

As a national financial regulator, Luxembourg's Commission de Surveillance du Secteur Financier (CSSF) has always been welcoming for fintech innovation. In 2016 the country became the first in Europe to grant a state license to a cryptocurrency exchange.

A year later, the CSSF was ready to explore the possibilities of using blockchain for selling traditional financial instruments. A European company that develops innovative financial products met with Apla to deliver a comprehensive solution.

In just 24 hours, Apla's team developed a system for banks to sell financial instruments to investors and verified it as a Proof-of-Concept. Our application integrated financial sector professionals, CSSF revisors and investors into a single, safe, reliable and 100% transparent network.

Our contributions

  • Strategy
  • Process workflow research
  • User research
  • Development of ecosystem
  • Software application architecture
  • Quality assurance
  • Technical documentation
  • Third party security audit
  • Fully functional project (go live)

Background

Traditionally, the financial service industry relies on paper ledgers. This solution is time-consuming, expensive and insecure. Nevertheless, all the key operations, such as emitting financial instruments, their approval by national financial operators and subsequent sale to financial sector professionals, are still paper-based.

Blockchain could bring certain advantages to the financial sector across various innovative projects.

CSSF

Problems

  • Lack of transparency during polls or surveys
  • Lack of trust amongst citizens towards research organizations
  • Paper documents are vulnerable: securities can be lost or falsified
  • The issuer must inform the CSSF at least five days before it intends to submit an application for approval
  • It can take up to a month for the CCSF to approve financial instruments
  • Companies emitting securities also face delays due to inherent mistakes and spend money on re-application

All solved by one solution: Apla

Challenge

  • Create a blockchain app for issuing, approving and selling financial instruments.
  • Ensure 100% safe and transparent transactions.
  • Provide financial sector professionals with a reliable instrument.
  • Drive innovation in the industry.
Result

An application for selling financial instruments to investors, ready to be used by financial institutions worldwide

Approach

Create work specifications for required actions
Create registers for professionals, investors and financial instruments
Make a working prototype of the application
Proof-of-concept
1 day
Validated by client

Solution

  1. Financial sector professionals (FSPs) and investors receive access to the app via the financial regulator (CSSF).
  2. The FSP issuing the financial instrument sends it to the CSSF for approval.
  3. Approval time is decreased as the app excludes security issues and paperwork.
  4. Financial instruments approved by CSSF are transferred to a special register.
  1. Investors can buy the financial instruments with 100% confidence.
  2. The CSSF can see all the transactions with perfect transparency of securities trading.
  3. Each change of the record in the shareholders register, notification, etc. represents one single transaction in

Financial instruments:
issuance, verification
and selling

What we achieved

Before

After

Before

Risk that the documents can be lost or falsified.

After

Highest level ofsecurity.

Before

Settlements can take up to a month.

After

Before

Increased need for middle-office staff at the regulator (CSSF).

After

The app makespaperwork unnecessary.

Before

It takes time and effort to check market players and the complete history of their activities.

After

Securities issuance and trade aretransparent and accountable before the authorities at any time.

Potential outcome
for financial institutions

100%

Investors can buy the financial instruments with 100% confidence

500%

Approval of financial instruments is 500% faster.

Financial institutions can expand their customer base by offering white label blockchain solutions to corporate clients.

Quick and easy administration of virtual accounts for corporate clients and their shareholders.

Exchange services to trade tokens for fiat currencies.

Income from charging for account administration, transactions, AML validation or exchange services.

STATUS

The concept was successfully approved at the Proof-of-Concept stage
